content: last updated may 27 2025 fowler hat pattern designer allen williams all rights reserved this pattern may not be duplicated shared or sold without permission ● hook size h / 8 / 5mm ● yarn worsted weight ~5 ounces scraps work as well ● crochet abbreviations us chain chain single_crochet single_crochet blo back loop only ● recommended video tutorials fowler hat tutorial back loop only blo approximate size beginning chain length of longest fits head circumference working edge adult 46 17in / 43cm ~19-23in / 49-58cm teen 41 15in / 38cm ~17-19in / 43-49cm child 36 12in / 31cm ~13-17in / 33-43cm baby 31 8in / 20cm ~9-13in / 23-33cm about the design a ribbed hat that is super stretchy due to the alternating row of single_crochet in the back loop only it also creates a nice thick fabric that stands up to the toughest winters this crochet pattern is worked flat in back and forth row sizes are listed in the pattern as follows baby child teen adult follow the corresponding size you wish to make increase length of longest edge to make a larger/smaller circumference hat reduce/increase the beginning chain to make a longer/shorter hat the current pattern sizes allow for a generous 2-3 rolled up brim depending on the size while crocheting you ll be asked to skip some stitches on specified row which will create a natural taper on that side of the work on a subsequent row you ll crochet into fowler hat crochet pattern - allen williams all rights reserved last updated may 27 2025 these stitches this skipping of stitches on some row creates a narrower side that is the hat s top once the piece reaches the desired size it is folded in half and then crocheted along the two edges from bottom to the top the top is then sewn up note gauge is not provided as this pattern size depends on measuring your work to determine the size you are making use the table above as a guide it s suggested to wrap the work around your head as you work to reach your desired size set-up row row 1 chain 31 36 41 46 single_crochet in the 2nd chain from the hook and in each chain until only 3 4 5 5 chain remain chain 1 turn total 27 31 35 40 stitches worked in this row you are skipping the last set of stitches you will not work in these stitches on this row but will work them in a subsequent row note skipping these stitches creates the tapered top of the hat row 2 single_crochet in the blo of each st until the end of the row chain 1 turn total 27 31 35 40 stitches worked in this row row 3 single_crochet in the blo of each st to the end of the row including each of the 3 4 5 5 chain skipped previously chain 1 turn total 30 35 40 45 stitches worked in
